1.name: The Wizard of Oz
1.description: Dorothy Gale is swept away from a farm in Kansas to a magical land of Oz in a tornado and embarks on a quest with her new friends to see the Wizard who can help her return home to Kansas and help her friends as well.

2.name: Gone with the Wind
2.description: A manipulative woman and a roguish man conduct a turbulent romance during the American Civil War and Reconstruction periods.

3.name: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
3.description: In 15th century France, a gypsy girl is framed for murder by the infatuated Chief Justice, and only the deformed bellringer of Notre Dame Cathedral can save her.

4.name: Only Angels Have Wings
4.description: At a remote South American trading port, the manager of an air freight company is forced to risk his pilots' lives in order to win an important contract.

5.name: On Borrowed Time
5.description: A cantankerous old man takes in his beloved, orphaned grandson, whom he must protect at all costs, including from an agent of Death with the help of a magical apple tree.

6.name: Ninotchka
6.description: A stern Russian woman sent to Paris on official business finds herself attracted to a man who represents everything she is supposed to detest.

7.name: The Old Maid
7.description: The arrival of an ex-lover on a young woman's wedding day sets in motion a chain of events which will alter her and her cousin's lives forever.

8.name: Young Mr. Lincoln
8.description: A fictionalized account of the early life of the American president as a young lawyer facing his greatest court case.

9.name: Dodge City
9.description: A Texas cattle agent witnesses first hand, the brutal lawlessness of Dodge City and takes the job of sheriff to clean the town up.

10.name: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
10.description: A naive man is appointed to fill a vacancy in the United States Senate. His plans promptly collide with political corruption, but he doesn't back down.

11.name: Stagecoach
11.description: A group of people traveling on a stagecoach find their journey complicated by the threat of Geronimo and learn something about each other in the process.

12.name: Blackmail
12.description: John Ingram, successful oil-field firefighter, is really a chain-gang escapee. Someone out of his past finds him...

13.name: Gunga Din
13.description: In 19th century India, three British soldiers and a native waterbearer must stop a secret mass revival of the murderous Thuggee cult before it can rampage across the land.

14.name: Beauty for the Asking
14.description: Denny drops fiancée Jean and marries Flora who is worth ten million dollars. When Jean is fired from her job she decides to market the face cream she invented. She goes to Jeffrey and he ...                See full summary »

15.name: Babes in Arms
15.description: A group of vaudevillians struggling to compete with talkies hits the road hoping for a comeback. Frustrated to be left behind, all of their kids put on a show themselves to raise money for the families and to prove they've got talent, too.

16.name: Another Thin Man
16.description: An explosives manufacturer suspects a young man is out to kill him. He calls in new parents Nick and Nora to sort things out.

17.name: The Four Feathers
17.description: A timid British Army officer has quit and burns his last day summons to a war in Egypt. Calling him a coward, his girl friend and 3 officer friends give him a white feather. In redemption, he shadows his friends in war to save their lives.

18.name: The Women
18.description: A study of the lives and romantic entanglements of various interconnected women.

19.name: Dark Victory
19.description: A young socialite is diagnosed with an inoperable brain tumor, and must decide whether or not she'll meet her final days with dignity.

20.name: Wuthering Heights
20.description: A servant in the house of Wuthering Heights tells a traveller the unfortunate tale of lovers Cathy and Heathcliff.

21.name: Jesse James
21.description: After railroad agents forcibly evict the James family from their family farm, Jesse and Frank turn to banditry for revenge.

22.name: La règle du jeu
22.description: A bourgeois life in France at the onset of World War II, as the rich and their poor servants meet up at a French chateau.

23.name: The Spy in Black
23.description: A German submarine is sent to the Orkney Isles in 1917 to sink the British fleet.

24.name: Jamaica Inn
24.description: In Cornwall, 1819, a young woman discovers she's living near a gang of criminals who arrange shipwrecks for profit.

25.name: At the Circus
25.description: The Marx Brothers try to help the owner of a circus recover some stolen funds before he finds himself out of a job.

26.name: The Hound of the Baskervilles
26.description: Sherlock Holmes and Dr Watson investigate the legend of a supernatural hound, a beast that may be stalking a young heir on the fog-shrouded moorland that makes up his estate.

27.name: Destry Rides Again
27.description: When a tough western town needs taming, the mild-mannered son of a hard-nosed sheriff gets the job.

28.name: Of Mice and Men
28.description: Two itinerant migrant workers, one mentally disabled and the other his carer, take jobs as ranch hands during the Great Depression to fulfill their shared dream of owning their own ranch.

29.name: Beau Geste
29.description: Three adopted English brothers join the French Foreign Legion in North Africa, after one of them steals their adoptive family's famous heirloom sapphire.

30.name: The Little Princess
30.description: A little girl is left by her father in an exclusive seminary for girls, due to her father having to go to South Africa to fight in the Second Boer War.

31.name: Drums Along the Mohawk
31.description: Newlyweds Gil and Lana Martin try to establish a farm in the Mohawk Valley but are menaced by Indians and Tories as the Revolutionary War begins.

32.name: The Roaring Twenties
32.description: Three men attempt to make a living in Prohibitionist America after returning home from fighting together in World War I.

33.name: The Private Lives of Elizabeth and Essex
33.description: A depiction of the love/hate relationship between Queen Elizabeth I and Robert Devereux, the Earl of Essex.

34.name: Son of Frankenstein
34.description: One of the sons of Frankenstein finds his father's monster in a coma and revives him, only to find out he is controlled by Ygor who is bent on revenge.

35.name: Le jour se lève
35.description: After committing a murder, a man locks himself in his apartment and recollects the events that led him to the killing.

36.name: Gulliver's Travels
36.description: A doctor washes ashore on an island inhabited by little people.

37.name: Goodbye, Mr. Chips
37.description: An aged teacher and former headmaster of a boarding school recalls his career and his personal life over the decades.

38.name: Union Pacific
38.description: In 1862, Central Pacific and Union Pacific Railroads compete westward across the wilderness toward California.

39.name: Love Affair
39.description: A French playboy and an American former nightclub singer fall in love aboard a ship. They arrange to reunite six months later, after he has had a chance to earn a decent living.

40.name: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
40.description: The master sleuth hunts his archenemy, Professor Moriarty, who is planning the crime of the century.

41.name: Made for Each Other
41.description: While on a business trip, an ambitious young lawyer meets and immediately falls in love with a stranger. They wed the following day, and tragedy soon strikes.

42.name: Confessions of a Nazi Spy
42.description: FBI agent Ed Renard investigates the pre-War espionage activities of the German-American Bund.

43.name: Bridal Suite
43.description: An American playboy dumps his greedy finace and ends up marrying a woman from the alps.

44.name: It's a Wonderful World
44.description: When a tycoon is accused of murder, the private eye tracking him finds himself roped in as an accessory and attempts to evade police, kidnapping a poetess along the way.

45.name: The Story of Alexander Graham Bell
45.description: The story of how Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone.

46.name: Nancy Drew and the Hidden Staircase
46.description: Nancy helps two aging spinsters fulfill the byzantine provisions of their father's will, but the murder of their chauffeur complicates matters.

47.name: Golden Boy
47.description: Despite his musical talent, Joe Bonaparte wants to be a boxer.

48.name: The Man in the Iron Mask
48.description: Despotic King Louis XIV discovers he has a twin brother who has grown up under the tutelage of his foster father, the patriotic musketeer D'Artagnan.

49.name: Intermezzo: A Love Story
49.description: A concert violinist becomes charmed with his daughter's talented piano teacher. When he invites her to go on tour with him, they make beautiful music away from the concert hall as well. He ...                See full summary »

50.name: The Flying Deuces
50.description: Ollie has fallen in love with the innkeeper's daughter in Paris. The only problem - she's very much in love with her husband. To forget her he joins the Foreign Legion with Stan. Bad idea.
